text: 380px Leda and the Swan is a tempera grassa on panel painting by an artist from the circle of Leonardo da Vinci, probably Cesare da Sesto. It dates to c.1510-1520 and is now in the Galleria Borghese in Rome. It and other versions at Wilton House and the Uffizi are considered the three best copies after Leonardo's own lost Leda and the Swan. ==References== category:1510s paintings category:Leonardo da Vinci category:Paintings in the Borghese Collection Galleria Borghese
title: Leda and the Swan (Galleria Borghese)
